articles.headline: For Biden, an Era When Treaties Are More Likely to Be Broken Than Brokered
articles.snippet: The president’s trip to Northern Ireland will mark the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, which ended decades of violence. But such breakthroughs are harder to achieve in today’s fractious world.
articles.abstract: The president’s trip to Northern Ireland will mark the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, which ended decades of violence. But such breakthroughs are harder to achieve in today’s fractious world.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden leaves on Tuesday for Northern Ireland to mark the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement, which ended decades of sectarian violence. But the commemoration also serves as an unspoken reminder that such diplomatic breakthroughs have become a thing of the past.

articles.headline: In China, Young People Ditch Prestige Jobs for Manual Labor
articles.snippet: Some people who’ve walked away from China’s grueling corporate culture say it’s worth the financial sacrifice. “I was tired of living like that,” one said.
articles.abstract: Some people who’ve walked away from China’s grueling corporate culture say it’s worth the financial sacrifice. “I was tired of living like that,” one said.
articles.lead_paragraph: By the usual measures, Loretta Liu had it made. She graduated in 2018 from one of China’s top universities, rented an apartment in the glamorous city of Shenzhen, and had been hired as a visual designer at a series of high-flying companies, even as youth unemployment in China was reaching record highs.
articles.byline: By Vivian Wang and Zixu Wang

articles.headline: Automakers Face Test in Reaching U.S. Target for Electric Vehicles
articles.snippet: New federal rules are expected to speed the transition to E.V.s, a shift that car companies have embraced but will be challenged to carry out.
articles.abstract: New federal rules are expected to speed the transition to E.V.s, a shift that car companies have embraced but will be challenged to carry out.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration’s plan to accelerate the adoption of electric vehicles — reaching a two-thirds share of new cars in less than a decade — pushes automakers further in a direction they have already been going. But meeting the new timetable will be a challenge.

articles.headline: Pressured by Their Base on Abortion, Republicans Strain to Find a Way Forward
articles.snippet: Some in the party are urging compromise, warning of dire electoral consequences for 2024, while other stances, on guns and gay rights, also risk turning off moderates.
articles.abstract: Some in the party are urging compromise, warning of dire electoral consequences for 2024, while other stances, on guns and gay rights, also risk turning off moderates.
articles.lead_paragraph: Republican leaders have followed an emboldened base of conservative activists into what increasingly looks like a political cul-de-sac on the issue of abortion — a tightly confined absolutist position that has limited their options ahead of the 2024 election season, even as some in the party push for moderation.

articles.headline: ‘Succession’ and ‘Dr. Pimple Popper’ Together in New Warner Streaming App
articles.snippet: The service, expected to be called Max, is meant to help the company compete more directly with Netflix and Disney.
articles.abstract: The service, expected to be called Max, is meant to help the company compete more directly with Netflix and Disney.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, the media mogul David Zaslav said he had a plan to compete with the streaming titans Netflix and Disney: Combine the scripted entertainment of HBO Max with Discovery’s library of reality and unscripted series. The goal, he said in 2021, was to be “one of the top streaming companies in the world.”

articles.headline: How Ukraine’s Power Grid Survived So Many Russian Bombings
articles.snippet: Russia was determined to break Ukrainians’ will by plunging them into cold and darkness. Its failure, in the face of Ukrainian resilience, offers lessons as winter has released its icy grip.
articles.abstract: Russia was determined to break Ukrainians’ will by plunging them into cold and darkness. Its failure, in the face of Ukrainian resilience, offers lessons as winter has released its icy grip.
articles.lead_paragraph: Electric trams are running again in Kyiv, and electric scooters dot the sidewalks. With curfew extended to midnight, the streets are bright and buzzing. Portable generators, nearly impossible to find as they flew off the shelves in December, are being sold at half price.

articles.headline: I.M.F. Lowers Growth Outlook Amid Financial System Tremors
articles.snippet: The International Monetary Fund says a painful slowdown, which could include a recession, has become a bigger risk for the global economy.
articles.abstract: The International Monetary Fund says a painful slowdown, which could include a recession, has become a bigger risk for the global economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The world economy faces the increasing risk of a painful slowdown amid worries about the global banking system and concerns that rising interest rates could force banks to curtail lending, the International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: California Economy Is on Edge After Tech Layoffs and Studio Cutbacks
articles.snippet: As recession fears persist, the troubles in major industries have hurt tax revenues, turning the state’s $100 billion surplus into a deficit.
articles.abstract: As recession fears persist, the troubles in major industries have hurt tax revenues, turning the state’s $100 billion surplus into a deficit.
articles.lead_paragraph: California has often been at the country’s economic forefront. Now, as fears of a national recession continue to nag, the state is hoping not to lead the way there.
